intro: Trichanthemis litwinowii, commonly known as the Litwinowii tansy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are narrow and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are arranged in dense clusters. Trichanthemis litwinowii is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and drought tolerance.
